intro: Lithocardium laxiflorum, commonly known as the slender-flowered rock-violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Lithocardium laxiflorum is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions, making it a hardy species in arid and coastal habitats.
